Articles.Content:
Hi folks!

I just realized i rushed into discussions and challenges without introducing myself properly.

- I'm 23 or 24 years old (have to ask my parents on that) 

- I live in Saarbrücken, Germany wich is close to to France and not far from Luxembourg.

- I speak German, English, a bit of French and I understand Luxembourgish.

- I'm studying since 2012. I started studying renewable energies and switchen to physics and finally to physics and chemistry to become a teacher. I'm planning on doing school projects with KSP in the future.

- I've been playing KSP since version 1.1.3 (or thereabouts) for about 600 hours now and joined the Forums to participate in challenges and maybe write a few tutorials.

- The reason I bought KSP in the first place is Scott Manly.

Nice to be here.
Welcome to our forum, Physics Student.

Welcome to the forum where everyone is a rocket nerd! You will enjoy your stay. Trust me, I'm an engineer. (Well not a real one but in KSP, I am. Also love your avatar!

Edit: Woah wait. 600 hours since 1.1.3?! I think that your hooked...

Fire

 

Edited February 26, 2017 by Firemetal
